NOTE_ID: note_070
SOURCE_FILE: note_070.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Johnson

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 51-year-old male who presents with a Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field (R91.8) requiring bronchoscopic diagnosis and staging.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.

Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field

ROSE conclusive for malignant neoplasm (lung nodule) 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial airway clearance) 

Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to RUL target 

Balloon dilation of airway 

Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization 

Cone-beam CT imaging (Cios Spin) with 3D reconstruction 

TBNA of RUL target (6 samples) 

Transbronchial biopsy (TBBX) of RUL target (2 samples) 

Transbronchial cryobiopsy of RUL target (6 samples) 

Transbronchial brushing of RUL target 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) 

Fiducial marker placement 

EBUS-TBNA staging (Station 7) with elastography 

ATTENDING Dr. Miller

ASSISTANT Dr. Lee

SUPPORT STAFF RN: M. Davis RT: T. Clark

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and 
BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS, Radial EBUS, Ion Robotic Bronchoscope, Disposable Bronchoscope, Cios Spin system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.

Robotic Navigational Bronchoscopy (Ion) — RUL Nodule A CT scan was used to generate a 3D rendering of the pathway, which was verified and loaded into the robotic platform.

Robotic navigation was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.

The robotic catheter was used to engage the Anterior Segment of the RUL (RB3).

The target lesion measured approximately 2.1 cm in diameter.

Balloon Dilation Significant difficulties were encountered during navigation due to a airway stenosis.
A 6mm x 40mm Mustang balloon was used to dilate the distal airway under direct fluoro-guidance using Omnipaque 240 as the inflation agent.

Following dilation, the robotic bronchoscope was successfully navigated to the distal nodule.

Target Localization & Confirmation


Navigation: The Ion catheter was advanced to 1.0 cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS: Performed to confirm location; the nodule appeared Eccentric with a continuous margin.

Cone-Beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging.

3D reconstructions were interpreted on an independent workstation and passed to the Ion platform.

Adjustment: Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location.

I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

RUL Target Sampling


TBNA: Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with a 21G needle; total 6 samples collected for Cytology.

Forceps Biopsy: Transbronchial biopsy was performed with alligator forceps; total 2 samples collected for Pathology.

Cryobiopsy: Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with a 1.1mm cryoprobe (6-second freeze time); total 6 samples collected for Pathology.

Note: This patient required Transbronchial Cryobiopsies, resulting in >40% increased work due to technical difficulty and physical/mental effort required.

Brushing: Transbronchial brushing performed with a protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected for Microbiology.

BAL: Bronchoalveolar lavage performed with 40 cc NS instilled and 15 cc returned; sent for Cell Count, Microbiology, and Cytology.

Fiducial Placement: A fiducial marker (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO) was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopy guidance prior to withdrawal.

ROSE (Ion Procedure) conclusive for malignant neoplasm (lung nodule).

EBUS STAGING


Indications: Diagnostic and Staging. Technique: All lymph node stations were assessed.

Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.

Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and elastography was used to assess stiffness.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:

Station 11L: < 10 mm. Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Station 7 (Subcarinal): ≥ 10 mm. Type 2 elastographic pattern (mixed soft and stiff regions). Sampled.

Station 4R (Lower Paratracheal): < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Station 11Rs: < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).


Also Inspected: 4L (lower paratracheal).

COMPLICATIONS There were no immediate complications.

SPECIMENS

RUL Lung Nodule: TBNA, TBBX (Forceps), TBBX (Cryo), Brush, BAL 

Station 7: TBNA 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

51-year-old male with other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field.
Successful sampling of RUL nodule and Station 7 lymph node.

ROSE from lung nodule showed conclusive for malignant neoplasm (lung nodule).
Follow-up results in clinic.

Follow-up CXR.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.

Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D14.31 Benign neoplasm of right bronchus and lung

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D14.31 Benign neoplasm of right bronchus and lung

ROSE conclusive for adenocarcinoma 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial airway clearance) 

Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to RLL target 

Balloon dilation of airway 

Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization 

Cone-beam CT imaging (Cios Spin) with 3D reconstruction 

TBNA of RLL target (6 samples) 

Transbronchial biopsy (TBBX) of RLL target (2 samples) 

Transbronchial cryobiopsy of RLL target (6 samples) 

Transbronchial brushing of RLL target 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) 

Fiducial marker placement 

EBUS-TBNA staging (Station 7) with elastography 

ATTENDING Dr. Chen

ASSISTANT Dr. Khan

SUPPORT STAFF RN: L. White RT: T. Clark

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and 
BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS, Radial EBUS, Ion Robotic Bronchoscope, Disposable Bronchoscope, Cios Spin system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.

Robotic Navigational Bronchoscopy (Ion) — RLL Nodule A CT scan was used to generate a 3D rendering of the pathway, which was verified and loaded into the robotic platform.

Robotic navigation was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.

The robotic catheter was used to engage the Superior Segment of the RLL (RB6).

The target lesion measured approximately 2.8 cm in diameter.

Balloon Dilation Significant difficulties were encountered during navigation due to a airway stenosis.
A 6mm x 40mm Mustang balloon was used to dilate the distal airway under direct fluoro-guidance using Omnipaque 240 as the inflation agent.

Following dilation, the robotic bronchoscope was successfully navigated to the distal nodule.

Target Localization & Confirmation


Navigation: The Ion catheter was advanced to 1.0 cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS: Performed to confirm location; the nodule appeared Eccentric with a continuous margin.

Cone-Beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging.

3D reconstructions were interpreted on an independent workstation and passed to the Ion platform.

Adjustment: Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location.

I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

RLL Target Sampling


TBNA: Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with a 21G needle; total 6 samples collected for Cytology.

Forceps Biopsy: Transbronchial biopsy was performed with alligator forceps; total 2 samples collected for Pathology.

Cryobiopsy: Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with a 1.1mm cryoprobe (6-second freeze time); total 6 samples collected for Pathology.

Note: This patient required Transbronchial Cryobiopsies, resulting in >40% increased work due to technical difficulty and physical/mental effort required.

Brushing: Transbronchial brushing performed with a protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected for Microbiology.

BAL: Bronchoalveolar lavage performed with 40 cc NS instilled and 15 cc returned; sent for Cell Count, Microbiology, and Cytology.

Fiducial Placement: A fiducial marker (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO) was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopy guidance prior to withdrawal.

ROSE (Ion Procedure) conclusive for adenocarcinoma.

EBUS STAGING


Indications: Diagnostic and Staging. Technique: All lymph node stations were assessed.

Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.

Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and elastography was used to assess stiffness.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:

Station 11L: < 10 mm. Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Station 7 (Subcarinal): ≥ 10 mm. Type 2 elastographic pattern (mixed soft and stiff regions). Sampled.

Station 4R (Lower Paratracheal): < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Station 11Rs: < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).


Also Inspected: 4L (lower paratracheal).

COMPLICATIONS There were no immediate complications.

SPECIMENS

RLL Lung Nodule: TBNA, TBBX (Forceps), TBBX (Cryo), Brush, BAL 

Station 7: TBNA 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

34-year-old male with benign neoplasm of right bronchus and lung.
Successful sampling of RLL nodule and Station 7 lymph node.

ROSE from lung nodule showed conclusive for adenocarcinoma.
Follow-up results in clinic.

Follow-up CXR.

The robotic catheter was used to engage the Anterior Segment of the LUL (LB3).

The target lesion measured approximately 2.1 cm in diameter.

A 5mm x 20mm Mustang balloon was used to dilate the distal airway under direct fluoro-guidance using Omnipaque 240 as the inflation agent.

Target Localization & Confirmation


Navigation: The Ion catheter was advanced to 1.0 cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS: Performed to confirm location; the nodule appeared Eccentric with a continuous margin.

Cone-Beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging.

3D reconstructions were interpreted on an independent workstation and passed to the Ion platform.

I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and elastography was used to assess stiffness.

Station 7 (Subcarinal): ≥ 10 mm. Type 2 elastographic pattern (mixed soft and stiff regions). Sampled.

Station 4R (Lower Paratracheal): < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Station 11Rs: < 10 mm.
Type 1 elastographic pattern (predominantly soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).


Also Inspected: 4L (lower paratracheal).

COMPLICATIONS There were no immediate complications.

SPECIMENS

LUL Lung Nodule: TBNA, TBBX (Forceps), TBBX (Cryo), Brush, BAL 

Station 7: TBNA 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

41-year-old female with malignant neoplasm of upper lobe, right bronchus or lung.
Successful sampling of LUL nodule and Station 7 lymph node.

ROSE from lung nodule showed conclusive for adenocarcinoma.
Follow-up results in clinic.

Follow-up CXR.
